Translation: Devī spoke:
1.1 O Paraśreṣṭha, O Surottama! Is there another [form of] universal sacrifice,
which is free of pain, which is easy, and which does not require an abundance of wealth, O Īśvara?
11.2 And teach me for the benefit of mankind, O Suraśreṣṭha, how to obtain the fruits of [this] universal sacrifice, which is praised even by the gods.
11.3 Maheśvara spoke

Main text: na tulyaṃ tava paśyāmi dayā bhūteṣu bhāmini
Translation: I cannot see anything comparable to your compassion towards living beings, O Bhāminī.

Main text: kim anyat kathayiṣyāmi dayā yatra na vidyate
Translation: What else could I teach concerning which there is no compassion [in you]?
11.4 I heard [this] previously from Sadāśiva's mouth, O Varasundarī.
Listen, O Goddess, I shall teach you the ultimate essence of Dharma.

Main text: vinārthena tu yo yajñaḥ sa yajñaḥ sārvakāmikaḥ
Translation: 11.5 The sacrifice that is without wealth satisfies all desires.
It is undecaying and imperishable, and removes all sins.
11.6 Money causes many obstacles and much troubler,
similarly to Indra's murder of a Brahmin [Viśvarūpa?], which yielded fruits that were distributed [among trees, lands etc.].
11.7 Sacrifice with money can be purified by the five purifications.

Main text: śodhite tu phalaṃ śuddham aśuddhe niṣphalaṃ bhavet
Translation: If it is purified, then the fruits will also be pure. If it is not purified, there is no fruit.
11.8 Devī spoke:
I am not sure about the five purifications.
Please teach [them to] me one by one, I want to hear it as they really are.
11.9 Rudra spoke:

Main text: manaḥśuddhis tu prathamaṃ dravyaśuddhir ataḥ param
Translation: The first is the purification of the mind, then it is the purification of the substances.

Main text: mantraśuddhis tṛtīyā tu karmaśuddhir ataḥ param
Translation: The third is the purification of the mantras, then the purification of the ritual.

Main text: pañcamī sattvaśuddhis tu kratuśuddhiś ca pañcadhā
Translation: The fifth is the purification of Sattva, and [the last one is] the purification of the sacrifice.
11.10 The purification of the mind is [achived] by mentally creating what is right.
The purification of the substances is by [using] substances that were not obtained by unlawful means.
11.11 The purification of the mantras is [achived] by the [proper] joining of vowels and consonants.
The purification of the ritual is [achived] by not reversing the proper sequence.
